voicePractice.title: Live Speaking Practice
voicePractice.subtitle: Speak it out—progress follows.
voicePractice.scenarioPlaceholder: e.g. IELTS speaking Part 2 / Daily conversation / Interview mock…
voicePractice.scenarioHelpTitle: How to write a good scenario?
voicePractice.scenarioHelp:
Write it as a specific task. The more specific, the better (role + goal + constraints). Examples:
- Mock interview: self introduction for data analyst
- Ordering coffee: ask for recommendations and prices
- Discuss my course project and answer follow-up questions
voicePractice.noSessions: No voice sessions yet. Create one first.
voicePractice.hint: Welcome to live speaking practice. Click “Start” to begin a turn, then click “End turn” to get the AI reply.
voicePractice.empty: No messages yet. Start a speaking session.
voicePractice.saveTip: Tip: End the turn to receive the AI reply (saved automatically)

login.a: Click 'Forgot password' on the login page, enter your email, then follow the reset link sent to you.

profile.a: Go to 'Profile' after login, edit fields and save.

security.a: Use strong passwords, rotate regularly, avoid saving login on public devices, and sign out in time.

support.a: Use Email or WeChat from the 'Support' section on this page.

enrollment.a: Choose a course on the course list, click enroll/learn. Paid courses appear in 'My courses' after payment.

progress.a: By completed lessons. Progress updates automatically and is visible on the course detail page.

submit.a: Go to 'Assignments', open the pending task, follow the instructions to fill/upload and submit.

browser.a: For best experience, use the latest Chrome. Other browsers may work with limited features.

cache.q: How to clear cache when issues occur?
cache.a: Clear site cache and cookies in your browser settings, then re-login and retry.

uploads.a: Check file type/size as prompted and ensure a stable connection. If it persists, contact support.

notify.ticketSuccessMsg: We will handle your issue as soon as possible.
notify.ticketFailMsg: An error occurred while submitting the ticket. Please try again later.
notify.feedbackFailMsg: An error occurred while submitting feedback.

MORAL_COGNITION.analysis: Moral reasoning — this period {scoreA}, compare ({baseline}) {scoreB}, change {delta}
MORAL_COGNITION.suggestion: Reflect on principles and strengthen argument chains.

LEARNING_ATTITUDE.analysis: Learning attitude — this period {scoreA}, compare ({baseline}) {scoreB}, change {delta}
LEARNING_ATTITUDE.suggestion: Enhance motivation and maintain focused study sessions.

LEARNING_ABILITY.analysis: Learning ability — this period {scoreA}, compare ({baseline}) {scoreB}, change {delta}
LEARNING_ABILITY.suggestion: Practice higher-order thinking and metacognitive cycles.

LEARNING_METHOD.analysis: Learning strategy — this period {scoreA}, compare ({baseline}) {scoreB}, change {delta}
LEARNING_METHOD.suggestion: Adopt diverse strategies and deepen semantic processing.

ACADEMIC_GRADE.analysis: Academic grade — this period {scoreA}, compare ({baseline}) {scoreB}, change {delta}
ACADEMIC_GRADE.suggestion: Consolidate knowledge points and review weak topics.

MORAL_COGNITION.title: Moral Reasoning
MORAL_COGNITION.what: Stage of moral reasoning, breadth of moral foundations, argument and counter-argument chains
MORAL_COGNITION.abilities: Principled judgment, value weighing, critical thinking
MORAL_COGNITION.scoring: 1A Stage: self-interest/punishment → social norms → universal principles; 1B Breadth: 1 → 2 → ≥3 foundations; 1C Argument: unsupported → causal + one counter → coherent chain + explicit rebuttal

LEARNING_ATTITUDE.title: Learning Attitude
LEARNING_ATTITUDE.scoring: 2A Emotion: negative → mixed/neutral → clearly positive; 2B Persistence: give up → single attempt → multiple adjustments with reflection; 2C Focus: off-topic → mostly focused → structured with smooth transitions

LEARNING_ABILITY.title: Learning Ability
LEARNING_ABILITY.abilities: Higher-order thinking, reflective improvement, cross-domain transfer
LEARNING_ABILITY.scoring: 3A Bloom: remember/understand → apply/analyze → evaluate/create; 3B Metacognition: none → one/two stages → full cycle with concrete adjustments; 3C Transfer: none → near → clear far transfer

LEARNING_METHOD.title: Learning Strategy
LEARNING_METHOD.what: Strategy diversity, depth of processing, self-regulation (before–during–after)
LEARNING_METHOD.scoring: 4A Diversity: single → two weakly integrated → ≥3 effectively combined; 4B Depth: listing/copying → some explanation → semantic reconstruction with multiple connections; 4C Regulation: none → partial → full cycle with specific next steps

ACADEMIC_GRADE.title: Academic Grade
ACADEMIC_GRADE.what: Overall performance in coursework/exams (normalized to percentage)
ACADEMIC_GRADE.scoring: Aggregated from grades and normalized by score/max to 0–100, on the same scale as other dimensions
